stimulusHtml: Which of the following accurately explains the ideological divide between Eastern and Western Europe during the Cold War?

features.html: The following question refers to the topic of the Cold War and contemporary Europe.

choicesHtml: Western European governments believed in providing citizens with the protections of a welfare state, while Eastern European governments believed education and health care should be private matters.
Western European governments favored capitalism and liberal democracy, while Eastern European governments favored central economic planning under authoritarian government.
Western European governments favored granting overseas colonial territories their independence, while Eastern European governments favored continued European rule of overseas colonies.
Western European governments favored transitioning from an industrial economy to an information economy, while Eastern European governments continued to rely on an industrial economy.
